choices.D: anticipated business functionality may not be delivered.
choices.C: project costs could increase above the original project budget.
choices.B: the project has not followed project management standards.
choices.A: there could be significant delays in project completion.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor is performing a project review and finds that scope reductions have been made without proper authorization. The IS auditor should be MOST concerned that:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. anticipated business functionality may not be delivered.

Selected Answer: B
This is the most concerning issue because unauthorized scope reductions indicate a failure to adhere to established project management processes, which can lead to further governance and accountability issues in the project.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important to include in a contract with a software development service provider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
While a Service Level Agreement (SLA) (Option B) outlines the agreed-upon level of service, including performance metrics and support terms, ownership of intellectual property (Option C) is often considered more critical. Intellectual property rights define who owns the software code and related assets developed during the engagement. Clarity on ownership ensures that the organization retains control over its proprietary technology and can use, modify, and distribute the software as needed without restrictions or disputes.

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer

Selected Answer: C
I think the correct answer should be C since the third party vendor is a software development company which means the service it is providing is to create intellectual product instead of just so sort of cloud service. It is more important to ensure the ownership in this case.

Selected Answer: B
Check RM chapter 2.10.1: Incorporate service quality expectations was listed first. IP was mentioned in the 3rd page of what yo consider in outsourcing contracts
Bill Gates will love this......Lol (Ownership of IP)
Why does it say C and not B? I have read in the CRM about Intellectual property rights as well, does it apply in this case?

choices.A: A list of key performance indicators (KPIs)

questions.question_text: How does a continuous integration/continuous development (CI/CD) process help to reduce software failure risk?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
This is a fundamental aspect of CI/CD. Automated testing ensures that each code change or addition is thoroughly tested, including unit tests, integration tests, and regression tests. By automating these tests, developers can quickly identify bugs and errors, ensuring that issues are caught early in the development cycle before they can escalate into larger problems or cause software failures in production environments.

CI/CD processes automate various stages of software development, including testing. Automated testing allows for the rapid and consistent validation of code changes, ensuring that new code integrates smoothly with existing code and functions as expected. By automating tests for each code change, developers can quickly identify and fix bugs or issues
So, C is better

questions.question_text: In reviewing the IT strategic plan, the IS auditor should consider whether it identifies the:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
major IT initiatives

Selected Answer: C
The IT strategic plan should outline the major IT initiatives that the organization plans to undertake to achieve its strategic objectives. These initiatives often encompass significant projects, investments, or efforts aimed at enhancing or transforming the organization's IT capabilities to support its overall goals and objectives.

In reviewing the IT strategic plan, the IS auditor should consider whether it identifies the major IT initiatives. This is because major IT initiatives outline the key projects, objectives, and goals that the organization intends to pursue to align its IT activities with its overall business objectives.
C is right answer

Selected Answer: D
IT Strategy plan should be linked to operational ,tactical or business development plan.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would the IS auditor MOST likely review to determine whether modifications to the operating system parameters were authorized?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The IS auditor would most likely review the change control log to determine whether modifications to the operating system parameters were authorized, as this log documents all approved changes and their related authorizations.
